page.title: 02AREA CHANGES I
page.content: The Links area mostly changed around 1945 because of the demolition of old houses as people moved away and factories such as Stocks and Lockharts, linen makers closed down. A ropery and string works also closed. The area was repopulated a bit in the 1960's by the building of council houses. Where the pool is now, there was a salt works. The salt came in rock form from Northern Ireland via River Forth. Next to that was a corn exchange. And near that was the town refuse where all the rubbish was burnt. In Tesco's car park there were many houses. There was also a fire station which was next to the corn exchange. In place of this there is the Mercat shopping centre, two multi storey car parks, a swimming pool and an open car park where the houses have been.
